services.title: High Yield and Special Mandates
services.description: We manage several high yield bond mandates for corporations, family trusts, endowments and some high net worth individuals
services.info:
**High Rock has created and manages a few very specific mandates for corporations, endowments, family offices and high net worth individuals.  Some of our specific solutions for these clients have included: **

1. A High Yield Bond mandate comprised entirely of energy bonds in the Spring 2016
2. A Canadian Preferred Share mandate comprised entirely of deep discount rate-reset preferred shares in November 2016
3. A High Yield Bond mandate of 22 diversified Canadian high yield bonds across various industry sectors in December 2017

nodes.question: How do I transfer my assets in from another institution?
nodes.answer: Once you provide High Rock Capital (HRCMI) with your latest investment statement from the delivering institution HRCMI will prepare the required documentation for your signature and initiate the transfer.

nodes.question: Can I have funds deposited to my bank account?
nodes.answer: Yes, HRCMI will set you up for automatic funds transfers to your bank account on a request or recurring basis.

nodes.question: Can I send funds electronically to my HRCMI account?
nodes.answer: Yes, Funds can be sent through the online bill payment with your bank using the payee: Raymond James and your HRCMI account number.

nodes.question: How and when will I receive my Tax information?
nodes.answer: Tax slips and Realized Gain/Loss information will be distributed by Raymond James according to the annual CRA Feb 28 th and March 31 st deadlines. If you have chosen to receive your account distributions electronically you will find your tax slips through your online account access.

nodes.question: Can I contribute funds from my TFSA to my RSP account?
nodes.answer: TFSA funds can be used for contribution to your RSP but not directly. You must withdraw the TFSA funds to a cash account, and then have them contributed to the RSP from there.

nodes.question: What is required to withdraw from our RESP?
nodes.answer: Proof of enrollment from the Educational Institution of choice ie: a copy of your invoice including your term of enrollment (course breakdown).
